EDIT: Interesting, Triston joined the day before me.

I'll be busy for the week...... Unexpectedly going to the Bahamas for the week..... Family issues

A Russian Soyuz rocket is set to launch a new three-man crew to the International Space Station at 12:37 a.m. EDT (0437 GMT) on Wednesdsay, Sept. 2, and you can watch the space action live online here, courtesy of NASA TV. The launch webcast will begin at 11:45 p.m. EDT (0345 GMT)

Woo....
Lucky for me its during the day here. This launch is motivation to get my baikonur finished!
Ummm... Time in AEST please
Can't believe I have school tomorrow... Soyuz launches are awesome when its day there... Can I skip school?

> 
> Ummm... Time in AEST please

Um like 2ish
Ok thanks

OK, I might need to do some "modifications" to the SLC-6 layout for the shuttle. I want stock shuttles to fit as well so I might be needing to move the booster flame trenches a bit and have the tail masts slightly further back from the shuttle.

Falcon 9 launch clamps anyone?

> [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/g5eOx)

I decided to redo my entire SpaceX launch complex for this mod, and with the complex now being done, I figured why not make the clamps as well? Once animated, they should work very much like the stock launch clamps ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

**Side note;** The clamps in the picture are not textured, they only have materials applied, hence the lack of detail. As of now the launch clamps are only statics and are meant for the SpaceX launchpad static for this mod. I'll animate them and release them as a separate thing eventually.

*Disclamier:* I didn't have really solid reference material, so they might not be 100% in terms of replication ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)
Liquid are you doing the Space X Vandenberg pad? I could do that one

> 
> Liquid are you doing the Space X Vandenberg pad? I could do that one

No I am doing the one at the Cape

This mornings atlas v launch
Mike-NZ just guit the forums ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

> 
> Mike-NZ just guit the forums ![:(](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_sad.gif)

That is such a shame. Seems like whoever takes on the CSS mod ususally leaves the forum eventually. It has happened twice(?) before.

> 
> That is such a shame. Seems like whoever takes on the CSS mod ususally leaves the forum. It has happened trwice(?) before.

The safety of the css is already being dealt with. I have gathered a team to continue the,project. And mike has given me his blessing to do so.
Well, it seems as though a team is going to work on it now, so hopefully that won't happen again. The sad part is how quickly it all went down.
Here's a cool thing. Mike has not totally abandoned it. He is a part of the team as well.
Ah, awesome! And please add me to the team Sampa.
Already accepted, but more on an intern level,while you learn your trade! When you are satisfied with your abilities, i'll start giving you,projects.
Ah, thanks so much! How long did it take you to learn?

I'm still learning. For thisproject, i am taking a managerial and janitorial position and crowd control. This way, the development team can do their work without the stress of countless people breathing down their necks. I will simply alert the right people of requests, decide on the severity of a,problem. Mike has joined up to assist in the background, so, he is not out of the picture yet.

Lol why are we talking about?
